Description.Text: Discover cutting edge contemporary design in the heart of London where Oxford Street meets Park Lane. The spectacular, spacious lobby creates a striking first impression with contemporary, original art and lighting. Every feature is beautifully considered at this iconic Hyde Park hotel, from the unique Jimi Hendrix Suite to destination bars and one of London?s finest restaurants, W1. Modern and luxurious, expect more from The Cumberland hotel with free wi-fi throughout. Leave the city outside with a choice of over 1,000 double-glazed luxury rooms, many with views of Hyde Park. Some of London?s best restaurants and bars can be found at this Marble Arch hotel. Mix it up at Carbon Bar featuring industrial modern design and headlining DJs or Patrón Bar, serving the finest tequilas. Expect the very best seasonal British food with a unique twist, served in W1 Restaurant or experience exclusive Private Dining. With five open kitchens, The Market will prepare breakfast fresh to order.
The hotel is centrally located on the corner of Oxford Street and Park Lane, overlooking Marble Arch and Hyde Park. The nearest underground station is Marble Arch almost next door to the hotel.

Our spacious, comfortable Cumberland Guest Rooms are the ideal place to relax and recharge. As well as everything you?d expect from Central London luxury hotels. Cumberland Guest Rooms have a 32? plasma TV in every room - comforts you?d normally associate with a 5-star London hotel. But at The Cumberland hotel, you?ll discover we believe in doing things up to a standard, not down to a price. Facilities Available: Hotel has Air Conditioning in all rooms Complimentary BT wifi Cardiovascular Gym Access Coffee and Tea Making Facilities Complimentary Toiletries Flat Screen LCD TV with Freeview Hairdryer Heated Bathroom Mirrors Power Shower Room Safe Stationery 24 Hour Room Service Work Desk
It is a large modern hotel with an art deco exterior. The main entrance is just off Oxford Street.

The hotel offers a choice of wining and dining options from the relaxed bar which has the feeling of a private club and the brasserie which offers all day dining up to the fine dining restaurant offering an exemplary standard of service and cuisine.

A very large lobby has the air of a contemporary art gallery with wide open spaces and life size sculptures. Behind the reception a constantly changing image is projected onto a bank of screens, whilst a floor to ceiling 'waterfall' in the centre of the lobby completes the spectacular 'wow' factor on entering the hotel.
